sub_title: Group Product Manager at Malvern Panalytical | Executive MBA candidate | Business Technologist | Material Scientist PhD | Lifelong Learner | LSSYB | Wine Enthusiast | Global Citizen
summary:
Hi there, thank you for your interest in my LinkedIn profile. I am a business technologist currently working in the scientific-instrument manufacturing industry as a group product manager at Malvern Panalytical. At Malvern Panalytical, we are actively developing innovative products to enable our customers to create a better world. If you want to know more, please visit our website at https://www.malvernpanalytical.com/

I have a multi-disciplinary background in science, engineering, and business, with PhD in Physical Chemistry and MSc in Applied Mathematics. I also hold certificates in negotiation mastery (HBS) and pricing strategy (IMD). Currently, I am pursuing an executive MBA degree at Maastricht University, specializing in digital business and expect to graduate in 2023. In the past 20 years, I have gained extensive experience in materials research, resource management and coaching, as well as research project/program management while working in government research organizations (CSIRO, NINT-NRC), chemicals industry (DSM), and automotive industry (Lightyear). To date, I have co-authored over 20 peer-reviewed scientific publications, book chapter, patent, and press articles.

My main technical expertise and interest cover a wide-range of topics, namely: 
-	polymer degradation and stability for automotive and electrical & electronic (E&E) applications (thermal oxidation and chemical degradation).
-	surface appearance of polymeric coatings (matting/gloss, transparent/translucent/opaque) for powder coating and liquid-based paint applications, as well as photovoltaic applications (backsheets). 
-	soft-condensed matter, colloid science, amphiphiles, polymeric surfactants, self-assembly (micelles), self-consistent-field/phase-field modelling (mesoscale).
-	numerical modelling and programming, high-temperature metal corrosion, ionic liquids and electrochemistry, optics.
- automotive lightweighting, energy storage, and renewable energy technology.

Going forward I envisage working at an interface between business (strategy, application, development), technology (research & innovation), people leadership, and customers (marketing and sales), focusing on the development and sustainable growth of innovative products/services.

Do you want to know more about me or do you have a specific question of which I might assist? Please feel free to get in touch by sending me a message via LinkedIn!

authors.headline: Group Product Manager at Malvern Panalytical | Executive MBA candidate | Business Technologist | Material Scientist PhD | Lifelong Learner | LSSYB | Wine Enthusiast | Global Citizen

profile_positions.description:
- Lead a team of research project managers covering all research projects within Lightyear in all four research tracks related to solar technology, vehicle efficiency, modelling & optimization, and autonomous driving technology. 
- As part of research management team at Lightyear, shape and improve all processes within research including the implementation of Agile way-of-work in research, early part of product creation process (TRL0-4), and implementation of technology roadmap. Accountable for successful ideation, execution, and implementation of innovative ideas via research projects with direct link towards future products.
profile_positions.title: Lead Project Management Research

profile_positions.description:
- Build and shape research department together with VP Research and CTO. Develop research process, way-of-work, internal alignments, external collaborations, and research ideation and resource processes. 
- Manage and lead a portfolio of ca. 30 research projects, including several use cases and work-packages in large EU-funded projects (each > Euro 1M). All research projects focus on technologies for next generation solar electric vehicles and automotive solar roof products.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Research

profile_positions.description:
- Lead Functional Properties group at DSM Materials Science Center. Resource/career manager and coach of 15 multidisciplinary, multinational material scientists (10 PhDs, 5 lab technicians) in the field of barrier properties and electronics & electrical properties of polymers.
- Implement an R&D roadmap for the group together with key principal scientists at DSM Materials Science Center. 
- Accountable for the health and safety matters in the Functional Properties Lab.
- Create and implement annual plans for projects staffing and Capex.
profile_positions.title: Group Lead Functional Properties

profile_positions.description:
- Lead multiple research projects at DSM Materials Science Center, a shared research unit within DSM material cluster. Projects cover a wide-range of multidisciplinary topics such as polymer degradation and stability for automotive and electrical & electronic (E&E) applications (thermal oxidation and chemical degradation), surface appearance of paints/polymeric coatings (matting, transparency), metal corrosion during high temperature polymer processing, and optimized backsheets for solar/photovoltaic module applications.
- Subject matter expert in the degradation and stability of engineering polymers, surface appearance of powder coating or liquid-based paints (optics behind matt/gloss appearance, surface texture, optimized paint formulation), metal corrosion, statistical thermodynamics, phase-field and mesoscale modelling.
- Science/tech talks, webinars for automotive customers.
- Content and project management coachings to material scientists and lab specialists.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
- Member of a research program management team for high performance polyamides at DSM Materials Science Center. Organize review process & budget, align/steer direction of multiple research projects with key internal R&D stakeholders.
- R&D Lean/Continuous Improvement facilitator at DSM Materials Science Center.
- Capex facilitator at DSM Materials Science Center.
profile_positions.title: Program Management Team

profile_positions.description:
- Coordinate 10+ multicompetence, innovative research projects within the functional surfaces and coatings research platform at DSM Materials Science Center.
- Organize review process, facilitate knowledge/resource sharing between all projects within the platform, and align outcomes with multiple internal stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Research Platform Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Joint postdoctoral fellow of CSIRO and ANSTO.
- Lead a multidisciplinary research project and implemented a combination of numerical modelling and experimental techniques (x-ray and neutron reflectometry, x-ray diffraction and electrochemistry) to study the structure-property relationship of ionic liquids at electrode surfaces and in the bulk.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral fellow

company.name: National Institute for Nanotechnology, University of Alberta

profile_positions.company: National Research Council Canada / Conseil national de recherches Canada
profile_positions.description:
- Developed and applied a self-consistent-field model to study the self-assembly of pulmonary surfactants.
- Developed kinetics model to study the dissolution process of polymeric resists/masks during chemical etching in electron-beam lithography applications.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral fellow

profile_positions.description:
- Applied a self-consistent-field model to study the self-assembly of novel thermal-reversible surfactants for water treatment applications. Validated the outcomes of the model with a series of experimental study using light scattering and calorimetry techniques.
- Teaching assistant for bachelor/master courses primarily in the topic of general physical chemistry, chemistry for life sciences, colloid science, molecular sciences.
profile_positions.title: PhD/Teaching assistant

profile_positions.description: Developed numerical model to estimate multi-directional wave fields based on existing wave elevation data. The outcome of this research leads to a better understanding of the behavior of short-crested waves in the ocean linked to better offshore structure designs.
profile_positions.title: Intern
